text: Geoffrey Emerick (5 December 1945 â€“ 2 October 2018) was an English recording studio audio engineer. He worked with the Beatles on their albums Revolver, Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band, The Beatles and Abbey Road. Emerick won four Grammy Awards for his work. Emerick was born in London. Emerick died on 2 October 2018 in Los Angeles, California from a heart attack, aged 72.Geoff Emerick, Beatles Chief Recording Engineer, Dies at 72 ==References== Category:British Grammy Award winners Category:1945 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Record producers Category:British audio engineers Category:Musicians from London
title: Geoff Emerick
